page.title: 11Staple Hill Police Station.
page.content: Staple-Hill, a{divisional station serving the Kingswood area, employs about 80 policemen and women.An Outer Office is for inquiries or reports made by the public.A Telephone Exchange houses telex machines, telephones and computers.In a Control Room 2 radio operators work 3 types of radio:1.between stations 2.to cars (vhf) 3.personal (uhf) used by men on beat.In an Interview Room suspects are questioned and fingerprints taken.{Suspects}are charged and searched in the Charge Room.There are 4{cells,}each with a bench and mattress.A{police shift}may be 9.45p.m -6.00a.m, 5.45p.m-2.00 a.m,or 1.45p.m -10.00p.m.In a Briefing Room men are told about the past 24 hour events. There is also a gymnasium/games hall, a pub and canteen, accommodation for 18 men and kennels for lost dogs.
